ABSTRACT.S: In unification-based or information-based linguisticframeworks, the most important objects are struc tures called 'feature structures' (FSs), which are usedto describe linguistic objects and phenomena.
A fea ture structure is either atomic or complex: an atomic FS is denoted by an atomic symbol; a complex FS consists of a set of feature-value pairs each of which describes an aspect of an object.
